newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha firm with crude and livelier gasoline.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha firm with crude and livelier gasoline.

text.p: NWE naphtha was firm on Thursday in line with stronger crude and a livelier gasoline market, traders said.
"It's not too busy but there's a bit more on offer," one trader said.
Naphtha swaps were talked at $192/$193 for June and $1.0 above there for July paper.
There was talk that a high paraffinic naphtha cargo traded out of Immingham at around quotes +$2.75/$3.0 cif NWE.
Fob barrels were also on offer. Traders assessed prices to be around $183/185 fob Rotterdam.
